oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn. Telegram in support of ratification.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Unsigned (incomplete) telegram to Harry T. Burn in supposrt of ratification. August 14, 1920.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women's suffrage; Politics & government; Telegrams;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
WESTERN UNION TELEGRAM NEWCOMB CARLTON, president GEORGE W. E. ATKINS, first Vice-president RECEIVED AT A452C 110 17 EXTRA BLUE KY WASHINGTON DC 1230p 14 1920 August 14 PM 2 52 HARRY T BURN 365 NASHVILLE TENN
REPUBLICANS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY ARE CONFIDENTLY EXPECTING YOU TO VOTE FOR WOMAN SUFFRAGE AMENDMENT ON MONDAY FOLLOWING EXAMPLE OP OUR PARTY IN TiHE SENATE IT IS ABSOLUTELY IMPERATIVE THAT REPUBLICAN HOUSE MEMBERS VOTE AS A SOLID BLOCK FOR THE AMENDMENT INTHE HOUSE TO INSURE THE SUPPORT Of REPUBLICAN WOMEN IN THE TWENTY STATES WHERE WOMEN NOW VOTE PARTICULARLY IN THE WEST PLEASE USE YOUR UTMOST INFLUENCE WITH ALL HOUSE
